ygData.subject: Re: Keeping the Paladin alive
ygData.msgSnippet: Otherwise know as BIG BAD CLAYMORE
ygData.messageBody:
Otherwise know as BIG BAD CLAYMORE

> -----Original Message-----
> From: McConnell, Jeff [mailto:Jeff.McConnell@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, May 25, 1999 7:36 AM
> To: 'eqpaladin@onelist.com'
> Subject: Re: [eqpaladin] Keeping the Paladin alive
>
>
> From: "McConnell, Jeff" <Jeff.McConnell@...>
>
> Bone Bladed Claymore
> Silvermyst
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Chris Ferriera [SMTP:cferriera@...]
> > Sent: Tuesday, May 25, 1999 8:14 AM
> > To: 'eqpaladin@onelist.com'
> > Subject: Re: [eqpaladin] Keeping the Paladin alive
> >
> > From: Chris Ferriera <cferriera@...>
> >
> > What is this BBC i see everyone talking about?
> >
> > -Dyce
> >
> > > -----Original Message-----
> > > From: Ragnarok [SMTP:gvragnarok@...]
> > > Sent: Tuesday, May 25, 1999 12:05 AM
> > > To: eqpaladin@onelist.com
> > > Subject: Re: [eqpaladin] Keeping the Paladin alive
> > >
> > > From: "Ragnarok" <gvragnarok@...>
> > >
> > > I am from the Povar shar... er... server, and the Shiny Brass Shield
> > isn't
> > > that big a deal. Right now the "in" thing to have is the Cracked
> > > Something
> > > Something Shield off one of the named gnolls in High Pass Hold. Of
> > > course,
> > > that's where I've been the past few days, so I can't be too sure. It
> > > sells
> > > for about 150pp. The other gnoll has the Polished Granite Tommahawk,
> > which
> > > I
> > > think blows chunks (I just got one), but I've seen it go for
> 600pp. The
> > > other is the Shiny Brass Halberd, which is what I'm using now until I
> > get
> > > the BBC. Most people get them to sell now though.
> > >
> > > If anyone is on the Povar server, feel free to give me a tell. I just
> > got
> > > level 20, so hopefully I can get my last name soon. Right now I'm in
> > > Befallen cleaning house and taking revenge for what the place
> did to be
> > in
> > > the earlier levels.
> > >
> > > What is the Povar server? Never heard of it.
> > >
> > > Heh.
> > >
> > > Tiresias Haniel
> > > I am the Seventh. I serve Erollisi.
> > >
> > > ----- Original Message -----
> > > From: Mxyzptlk <hlf10@...>
> > > To: <eqpaladin@onelist.com>
> > > Sent: Monday, May 24, 1999 3:02 PM
> > > Subject: [eqpaladin] Keeping the Paladin alive
> > >
> > >
> > > > From: Mxyzptlk <hlf10@...>
> > > >
> > > > To answer a few questions first:
> > > > I play on the Rathe server as a humble Dwarf Paladin named "Dauldon
> > > Blackstone"
> > > > I was wondering about the list myself, glad to see it is still here.
> > > > I have not seen any remnants of the Elven empire in the
> deserts of Ro.
> > > >
> > > > A question:
> > > > I am not certain how the other servers operate, however on Rathe, it
> > > seems
> > > that a shiny brass shield is now one of the more rare items
> in the game.
> > > I
> > > have seen one being sold for as high as 100 platinum (ouch). The area
> > > that
> > > spawns the creature that occasionally has the shield, is
> always camped,
> > no
> > > matter the time of day I try. A magic shield, as you all know, is a
> > nice
> > > benefit to have with the bashing ability, to be able to hit creatures
> > that
> > > need magic to cause damage against them. Let me get to the question
> > > before
> > > I get to far off here.
> > > > Are there other magic shields that we as Paladins can use?
> > > > If so, would you mind sharing the information. It does not
> have to be
> > > very specific, just a hint or twelve <g>
> > > >
> > > > Also to comment on something else I read in one of the mails...
> > > > I would have to agree with the attitude of most people when a "Holy
> > > Knight" comes to the rescue (more often to our folly as the "rescuees"
> > run
> > > and the "rescuer" gets stuck with the fiends) and either lays hands or
> > > heals
> > > to the end of mana, as being less than satisfying. I
> however, feel like
> > I
> > > helped someone, albeit most likely someone who will watch me
> die in the
> > > future and not lift a finger to help. I think my chances are a bit
> > better
> > > for someone to help me if I help others and not watch another
> die while
> > > not
> > > even trying to help. Also from a role-playing aspect, I do
> believe the
> > > right thing is being done, never would a Paladin turn his head to such
> > > persons in distress.
> > > >
> > > >
> > > >
